result.execSummary:
The defendant Abraham I. Robertson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: AMENDED V/W surcharge shall be paid while defendant in prison and DNA analysis surcharge to be paid while defendant in prison. Both to be paid out of wages or other monies.

No contact with T.B. 
Not eligible for programming. 
Not entitled to any days credit.

Defendant does not begin paying court costs until extended supervision begins.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any sentence currently being served.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Case called: 2:43pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears by phone from WI State Prison System.
(Hearing re: Surcharges)

COURT  notes receipt of letter from DOC requesting amendment of surcharges - existing JOC states no CC payment until supervision begins; COURT addresses statutory authority regarding VW surcharge and DNA surcharge being requested to be collected while defendant is incarcerated.

COURT orders JOC Amended to reflect that V/W surcharge shall be paid while defendant in prison, and DNA analysis surcharge shall be paid while defendant in prison; Both to be paid out of wages or other monies.
COURT those rulings are mandated by the legislature
COURT directs JOC to be amended and copy to be sent to defendant and to the DOC author of letter.

Defendant questions re percentage of wages that will be taken - COURT notes that is a matter to be taken up with DOC office.

Adj: 2:48pm
Hearing on July 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on June 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Oshkosh Correctional  Inst. to COC re: surcharges

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 10:00am
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears by phone from WI State Prison System/pro se.
(Defendant's Request re: Fines)

COURT notes receipt of letter from defendant - Defendant requesting order that CC would not have to be paid until ES begins; State does not object.

COURT enters Amendment to JOC - Defendant does not begin paying CC until his ES begins on this case; Amended JOC to be sent to State, defendant, and WI State prison institution Oshkosh Correctional.
Defendant questions if he is eligible for his 75% - COURT takes no position and cannot help with that request - Defendant will need to research that himself.

Adj: 10:03am
Hearing on April 28, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on March 25, 2015 at 10:10 am.
to Judge Grau from A.R. - stj

PLEA:
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves Ct. 2 (Strangulation and Suffocation-Repeater)>>DRI and Ct. 3 (Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force-Repeater)>>DRI.  
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Battery by Prisoners-Repeater/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
COURT ORDERS: 4 1/2 years WSPS to run concurrent with any sentence currently being served - 18 months IC nd 3 years ES. CONDITIONS: No contact with T.B., Court Costs, DNA Surcharge, Not eligible for programming. COURT finds defendant is not entitled to any days credit.
Remanded to WSPS.
